description:
This place is awesome! I've been going to the Haight Street one for years and been coming to this location for the past 5yrs on a monthly basis, usually when I'm at The Make Out Room across the street. Both locations are slightly different but are more so the same.

 If I'm up for two slices I usually get a meat slice, usually the pepperoni and follow up with a pesto. I have never been to NY so I can't compare to NY pizza but this place is one of my favorite pizza places and I am someone who knows pizza well. I also like a variety of pizza places so all I can say is for you to try it and see how it goes. Judging pizza is almost like judging a burrito. Not one place is the best. It depends on the day of the establishment and depends on the establishment you're in the mood for.

So I say give it a try. Also the staff here has always been super cool. 

PS even though I don't come all the time I always carry their punch card!
author: Majid S.

description:
Pepperoni pizza was not fresh and too much on the reheated side, it was expensive, and not too friendly service.  

Why go here again when there are so many way better pizza places around.  

Escape from this joint.

Gave it one extra star for the Iron Maiden framed poster on the wall.
author: Christiani C.

description:
CRUST: 5/5 ------ Super good
^ they have thin & thick crust

PIZZA: 4/5-5/5 ----- Pretty damn good

+ LATE HOURS
+ DELIVERY AVAILABLE 

I have ZERO complaints about this place.

--------------------------------------

Last night, we ordered a pizza for delivery. 

My cousins and I were just having a chill hangout night-in watching movies and playing with puppies. 

Three of us already ate dinner, but my cousin Syd wasn't there yet (gets off work at 10:30) and we knew he'd be hungry. So we ordered from here.  

We ordered a custom pizza with olives (my request), sun-dried tomatoes (Tiff's request), and some other combo stuff with meat and whatnot.. And we ordered thick crust.
author: Lilian L.

description: The most condescending individual I have ever come into contact with. The worst customer service. This man TRIED to bully me into giving him a tip. Told me that if I couldn't afford gratuity that I should eat peanut butter from Trader Joe's. Gratuity is earned not expected. Escape from New York, you've gone down hill. So sad that you've resorted to hiring angry, ignorant, (toothless) individuals to run your cash register. I was appalled by this behavior.
author: Elisa D.

description: Came here last night to grab a slice while on break from class @ CCSF. I changed my mind on a slice that was being reheated because a fresh pineapple and ham pie was just pulled out of the oven. The clerk refused to exchange my slice because he claimed he "had to throw it out". Dude, it's already a re-heated slice that I'm paying $7 anyways. Whatever, I'll stick with getting food at the CCSF cafeteria. Pizza is over-priced and mediocre, I understand it's SF but jeez, I'm a student!
author: Manuel R.

description: This location is horrible. Super fat crust!!!! Not thin New York style. What's worse is the fact that amazon delivery charges u a $6.50 delivery fee and they force in a tip. Pizza sucked and was so fat it should have been called escape from Chicago pizza!!!! Snake pliskin does not approve!!! Also $40 bucks for a pesto pizza that shows up white with green speckles is unacceptable, glad I had pesto to add to this horrible overpriced and under packaged extra thick non New York style pie. Don't do it!!!!
author: scott m.

description:
By far my favorite pizza place. 
I have taken many friends with me and some have even commented that it is "better than NY pizza". I love NY and everything about it. I can't leave SF without a slice or two from this place!
My favorite location resides in Haight street, awesome to walk around after you've eaten too much pizza
author: Lizette B.

description:
Pizza: 5/5
Overall: My coworkers and I ordered for deliver so I can't comment on service or ambiance but what I do know is that the Potato Pesto Pizza is a SLAM DUNK!!!

The extended review...

Potato Pesto pizza - so at first I was very hesitant to try this combination.  Let's just say that I was very pleasantly surprised and overjoyed that I did eat it.  I can't think of another combination that was more delightful.
author: Spencer Q.

description:
Conveniently located across from "The Makeout Room" and open late, it's the perfect place to come beforehand to meet up with your friends or come afterwards, to regain the calories you just danced off. 

This place has been around for so long, I no longer crave just "pizza"... I ask for these slices by name:

You say Potato
Miss Figgy
The Gourmet
Glorious Chicken
Magnificent Meatball

Get that green punch card!
author: Mitzi G.

description: Well sadly, it's the end of a pizza chapter. After years of enjoying escape from ny pizza, I've decided to end our patronage. What started off as a love affair with the *you say potato* pizza, an awesome happy hour at the downtown location, and super tasty salads has become a series of super disappointing delivery experiences. The last three times we've ordered pizza from here the pizza has been subpar: either sloppily made, poorly transported, burnt on the bottom, or made with clearly expired dough (see pic). I realize businesses change and the closure of the location in the Castro was very disappointing but paying close to $100 for pizza to be delivered only to get pizza that is embarrassing to serve to my guests was the last straw. RIP escape from New York.
author: James S.

description: Ok so, I ordered a vegan pizza and they came to me 10 minutes later saying they were out of vegan cheese. I said that was fine and they could substitute an extra vegetable in place of the vegan cheese. They proceeded to give me a pizza with half regular mozzarella. I told them that was incorrect and was accused of giving them false information (fake news) about the cheese situation. They agreed to remake it once I conceded their argument. So rude.
author: Logan N.

description:
The only thing worse than a 52 minute wait, is a twice baked pizza!! My XL cheese pizza not only looked a ground beef pizza (yes, that burnt), but it also tasted of 3 day old dough. My chef friends (ironically FROM NY) took one slice and called this place's bluff. 

And if you think your getting ANY type of customer service, Good Luck!    

BUYER BEWARE!!
author: Steven G.

description:
i pretty much love good ingredient pizza and idk about you all but i can taste the difference in good cheese and flavorless cheese.

New York pizza delivers every time with thier yummy cheese and garlicky crust .

I also appreciate the fact that it's not overwhelmingly doughy slice of pizza .

one of my favorites in town
author: Aryssa M.

description: Anyone from NY knows that a real slice of pizza will fold - not crack into several pieces. This isn't necessarily a deal breaker but when you pair it with exorbitant cost ($5.50 for one extremely mediocre slice!) and pretty god awful service I'd say it's not worth it. Pro-tip: go 2 blocks away to Arizmendi if you want a cheap and delicious slice of pizza.
author: Jamie S.

description:
Great pizza. Great location.

I used to frequent Escape from New York Pizza after a night of bar hopping in the Mission, especially Makeout Room right across the street. They are a typical pizza joint. 

Now I eat at Escape every so often for lunch. The pizza slice and salad combo is under $10. Good deal. 

Staff could be friendlier, but no real complaints. 

Overall, this place is always a great choice.
author: Joanna S.

description:
We were looking for a place that delivered pizza to Dolores Park and I am very happy we found Escape from NY! 

I called a day early to make sure they delivered to the park and the gentleman that answered the phone was SOOO incredibly nice!! ( I was surprised because I saw previous reviews about the rude staff). Whoever I spoke to on the phone was so nice-- I wish I had asked for his name! 

I called back the next day to place the order and someone else answered the phone-- he was fine-- but not as nice as the other guy. 

We ordered 2 XL pizzas the Buffalo Ranch and Super Combo and a medium Pepperoni. The XL pizzas were HUGEEEEEE! My personal favorite was the buffalo ranch! The perfect amount of spicy and creamy. YUM! The super combo and pepperoni was just OK. 

Overall I felt the pizza was decent, but it was WAY expensive. Like over $100 for 3 pizzas. 

3 stars for the pizza and ability to deliver to Dolores Park and 1 extra star for the kind man who answered the phone the first time I called.
author: Roxy N.

description:
Greasy pizza didn't seem appetizing after an hour of swing dancing, but it wasn't a terrible choice. My boyfriend and I had finished class at Cat's Corner, and Escape from New York Pizza was close by. It wasn't busy compared to Lolo Cevicheria next door, so we ordered our pizza slices, choosing from the pre-cooked options in the glass display window, then finding a seat while waiting for our pizza to be heated up.

I selected the Hawaiian pizza, which was quite delicious, but it just can't replace the real deal. I mean, fresh pizza. The crust was too stale too eat, and I devoured the whole thing as quickly as possible to be done with it. On the bright side, this place is open late, and it's inexpensive. Good drunk snack if you're out in the Mission!
author: Stefanie C.

description: Awesome pizza, and a sweet little spot. Happy with what I got. They were fast, and the pizza was hot. I have no complaints. very happy with the service and the ambiance. A+ in my book
author: Ross S.

description: Escape from this restaurant! So many better pizza options. Stopped here late night for a late dinner, very disappointed. Pizza tasted though it was reheated several times and ingredients could be better
author: Charlene E.

description: A decent place to get late night pizza after hitting up bars in the mission. I had a slice of the combo and the pesto and it came out to less than $10. The slices are pretty big. I was lucky because the combo had just come out of the oven so it was piping hot. I actually burned the roof of my mouth because I was so excited to take a bite of that slice.
author: Mai Y.

description: This is my favourite/affordable for delivery pizza. And of course I always pass by and get some slice when suddenly get hungry. I love their potato pizza - I always say potato. They have outdoor curb side seating what is covent with a dog.
author: Liene C.

description: Excellent pizza. It's ok not the be actual NY pizza sometimes. Got the Marg and was great. The cupcake was also good.
author: Aj S.

description:
This pizza place was a lifesaver on a an early Sunday morning.

Starving and not wanting to drive around for food at 1am, we decided to order 2 large pies to feed our group of 5. 
- Ordering was a breeze and delivery was quick, we got our pizzas within 25mins.
- The buttery crust is thin and slightly chewy. There's a subtle sweetness to it, which I liked. 
- Good crust-to-toppings ratios for both of our pizzas.

THE GREAT ESCAPE: Pepperoni, mushrooms and onions. 
http://bit.ly/13uhjPo 
- Medium 14in = $22.20
- Large 18in = $27.70
- Extra large 20in = $30.45
**Additional toppings will cost you $1.75 (med), $2.25 (lg) and $2.50 (x-lg). We added olives to our large pizza. 

YOU SAY POTATO: Roasted sliced potatoes, whole roasted garlic cloves, topped with pesto sauce.
http://bit.ly/13uhnP6
- Medium 14in = $20.75
- Large 18in = $25.95
- Extra large 20in = $28.85

When my friend suggested this pie, I thought he was crazy. The thought of having potatoes on pizza sounded unappetizing to me. 

I freakin' loved it!!
- The potatoes were sliced thin enough so that the taters were nice and crispy. 
- The roasted garlic cloves were so soft and sweet, delicious! 
- My only complaint was that there wasn't a lot of the pesto, I wanted to taste more pesto in each bite. 

They also have gluten-free crusts avail. But it's only avail in medium/14in crusts, and will cost you an additional $4.

These hours are for the Mission location only:
- In-store hours: Sun-Wed 11am-12am, Thurs-Sat 11am-2am.
- Pick-up & Delivery: Sun-Wed 11am-11:45pm, Thurs-Sat 11am-2am.

There's at total of 5 locations in SF: 
- Mission
- Soma
- Haight
- Polk
- Downtown: Think this is the only place that has happy hour from 4pm-6pm. $2.50 per slice and draft beer is a steal!

Thanks a bunch, Escape From NY! Best drunken decision ever, lol.
author: Cin T.

description: Highly convenient to the make out room (right across the street), friendly staff, lots of different kinds of pizza slices on display. Pizza has a medium-thin chewy crust which is somewhat reminiscent of NYC pizza, yes.  The pesto is delicious. About $5 for a huge slice. They also offer salads, but the small salad I saw was a lot smaller than the container it came in. Like they ran out of romaine or something.
author: Kaia V.

description:
A bit of a bummer. All the pizza has already been made which you know when you get up to the counter. They do warm up the pizza but it does t help that much. The crust is good. They had some interesting pizza topping combos.
The woman at the counter was really nice & I was thankful that she gave me 2 plates when i took my slice to go.
I would give them another try.

After giving them another try I would def recommend eating their pizza there. It is much more crispy & significantly better! I still would not give this place more than 3 stars but it's a decent option for late night eating after you've left a bar on a week day & even the Mission dog venders have packed up.
author: Ashley G.

description:
I made a quick stop at Escape from New York at the end of a Saturday night, mostly for a Diet Coke and the use of a bathroom. Both soda and bathroom were life-savingly adequate.

I gather that this place is part of a casual pizza chain, and it had the pleasant, bland, comfortable atmosphere to match. Service was quick and there was enough seating for us to grab a table for five. I ate some of someone else's pepperoni pizza and it was not bad, greasy and flavorful with thick, tough little pepperonis. It was even better with some garlic powder, which was out on the table for ready deployment.

Anyway, the pizza was fine and the soda and bathroom were necessary for my health. Nothing to go out of your way for, but well stocked with late-night amenities.
author: Steph C.

description: This place is a little pricey at $4-$5 for a slice of pizza. But it's super satisfying when I am craving late-night pizza after a night of drinking. It opens until 2 am on Fridays and Saturdays!
author: Alice S.

description: I ordered from here 2 times and it was excellent - the third time was a disaster - it was not edible- tasted like it had been sitting around for a week - threw it out. The restaurant did not respond when I emailed them - It's too bad - I will never try this place again
author: nancy S.

description: So I went from flash mobbing zombie to dance student in a matter of Muni stops. With 8-year-old in tow, I knew we had to get some dinner before my class and we had a small window of time. There are plenty of great food options in the 24th and Mission area but time was a ticking.  I was bemoaning the lack of quick, non fast-food options when we saw the sign for this pizza joint.  We rushed in and were treated to warm slices of thin crust pie. My daughter chose pepperoni and I ordered the Gourmet which includes spinach, feta, artichoke hearts, and sundried tomatoes. Delicious!  We admired the collection of blues LP covers and posters as we sat at a table near the window. I made my class in time. A great find!
author: Julie C.

description: I've been getting pizza delivered from here probably every 6 weeks for several years. I used to love it--and I'm from New Jersey.  Sometimes the pizza is 5 stars. But it has become so hit-or-miss in the past year, I have to give the place just 2 stars. The Liberty salad has remained very good.  Photo is this week's spottily burnt crust. I also think it says something that the manager doesn't reply to the negative reviews--indicates they don't  care. (I can't figure out how to include photo here)
author: Mary L.

description:
About me: 
I'm from NY and take my slices seriously. 

Writing this for: 
those seeking their NY pizza fix

Short version: 
Not here. 

Longer version:
Aside from being blankly stared at when I walked up to the counter and said, "two slices", the cheese is tough and stringy, sits on the pizza looking like it doesn't belong, the sauce is grainy and mealy, and the crust, just...cooked in the wrong oven or something - crispy and hollow. Doesn't fold but breaks...

For non pizza snobs who won't get their hopes up when they are promised NY pizza far from home, it'll do just fine. ;)
author: Sean C.

description: My all time favorite pizza EVER!!!  They make the BEST gluten free crust.  Not frozen, but BOMB!  Service is always stellar, friendly and fast!  Although I'm moving out of the area, I'll be back for their pizza monthly!  Thank you for always taking care of me!!!!  #pizzaluver
author: Kathryn F.

description: Although it sounds like an odd combination the potato pesto pizza is really great.  If you buy 7 times or so you get a free slice and the cashiers are pretty cool.
author: Mark P.

description: The only pizza place I order from. Always fast delivery, and if they are going to take longer they usually let me know before I place my order. The delivery guys are always nice. Everytime I ordered the pizza has been delish! Minus 1 star because its pretty pricey to me, 35 for a large 3 topping without a coupon.
author: Terese V.

description: Favorite cheap yummy pizza place in SF! They rotate out the pizza slices through out the day. Pesto is always a go to. Sometimes if you're lucky you can have a slice of the Miss Piggy (bacon, feta, dog and balsamic amazingness!) And if you wanna be "healthy" eat that veggie combo! They all do full puzzles but be prepared to wait an hour even for pick up. But it's worth that hour!
author: Amber T.

description: This Pizza spot is bomb. My review is for Delivery only. I've ordered the potato pizza a couple times and its delicious. The delivery is fast and the pizza is hot. For me its not "new york" pizza but its hard to find that on the west coast. This is my go to pizza place when at work!
author: J B.

description:
My friend and I called for a simple a delivery less than 2 miles away from the store. They basically refused delivery so we called another store that's even farther away, and they said sure we will deliver, there is some trouble getting to and fro N and South of Market. I can understand that when it is communicated is communicated . The condescending guy, who my friend and I spoke with, was not helpful at all with finding any alternative solution for us to get one of their pizzas. 

Kindness, sincerity, willingness to help others - all important to running any successful food biz. It felt like he was smiling when he decided not to be nice or helpful. At all. I don't know what kind of business is ok with sending customers away when they are only 1.5 miles away. I will post this review to Facebook and Twitter as well.
author: Steve L.

description: Do you like figs? Do you like bacon? How about together? Then order the Miss Figgy which also includes goat cheese, arugula and baby angels  melting in your mouth. That's how tasty it is. This place is a gem. Their customer service is great too, so you really can't go wrong here.
author: Victoria S.

description:
I order 2 slices of pizza to go and she asks me if I want a bag or just the plates, I ask her if there is anything that covers the plates and she looks at me like I'm the crazy one and says "Yeah, a bag"

Doesn't pizza come in a box? In fact wasn't there an entire line of boxes specifically created just for pizzas?

#Fail #pizzainabag #noboxforyourpizza
author: DC S.

description:
My favorite used to be the potato, garlic and pesto pizza, until I met the Miss Figgy. That balsamic drizzle on goat cheese, bacon, arugula and figs is just a perfect combination. I thought the figs would be too sweet, but I was pleasantly surprised to find it rather well-balanced. 

I like to pick up their pizzas for group movie nights (same price as my own cooking but much faster and less work) but the slices on a drink-filled evening also hit the spot when the elusive sidewalk hot dog stand escapes you. 

Sometimes they're delivered to my work, and based on that I won't be delivering to my home: the flavors are still there, so I still eat it, but the texture of the crust gets a little doughy/rubbery being in the box so long. 

Otherwise, pretty solid for casual pizza.
author: Krista L.

description: I'm a huge pizza snob. I'm from NY and think it's hilarious what some people will say is a "NY slice". Naturally, I rolled my eyes the first time I walked by Escape from NY Pizza. But then I tried it, and it's actually pretty legit! The size, consistency, cheese - it all works. I will happily come back for more and order delivery. Beats Papa Johns any day. Sorry for judging you too soon.
author: Sara M.

description: Delivery person totally rude and hung up on me mid-sentence after communications mix-up...sounded super stressed and overwhelmed, but man, he could've used a lesson in customer service.  Never again!!
author: Serena W.

description: Super bad service; or at least tonight... Girl working there really need to learn how to give a good customer service, jul/26/2016 9:30P she barely wanted to take my order, I didn't say nothing, after she forgot I got two slices, just gave me one, and after 20min I told her she forgot to give me one slice and starting giving me attitude like it was my foul. Good place to go drunk and whenever you don't really care about the customer service...
author: Dennys L.

description:
$4.5 =pepperoni slice 
$20 large pizza

Really

And display pizza u have to buy by the slice not as a whole

FLAT, LITE CHEESE, 2 SLICES OF PEPPERONI
author: Reylos G.

description:
If you're drunk or high, you'll love this place and their mediocre pizza that's slightly overpriced.

If you're on the sober side, you'll likely be underwhelmed by the quality and flavors.

We tried the pesto/potato pizza, the Hawaiian, and the mushroom, and neither of them offered anything worth mentioning other than mediocrity. I had high hopes for the Pesto Potato and the Hawaiian, but they simply didn't measure up. The pineapple was bland, the Canadian bacon dry and flavorless.

Better to look for a slice elsewhere.
author: Cameron N.

description:
glad I stopped and tryed this pizza spot..
I couldve just settled for one slice since I am now stuff beyond belief..but the first slice was just so good :)
Ill most definitely be coming back!!
service was awesome lady at the counter was very nice..thanks you guys!
author: Henry M.

description:
Decent slice of pizza (under $5 including tax) in the Mission, AND open late. Like many who are familiar with this local pizza chain, I'm a fan of the potato pizza (only when freshly made, not reheated). http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/escape-from-new-york-pizza-san-francisco-5?userid=8Ces6YdT6j7BYycnZLrSng#oXFspwgiUYeV4TuGPSb3uw

The space is small, but reasonably clean. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/escape-from-new-york-pizza-san-francisco-5?select=tGYVtmRbTfuU1lAQ60v_8Q#tGYVtmRbTfuU1lAQ60v_8Q And unlike other branches there's outdoor seating. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/escape-from-new-york-pizza-san-francisco-5?select=y_srlYEmmuGrdoznA-5czw#y_srlYEmmuGrdoznA-5czw

Each store has a few minor quirks that are different. This branch is one of 2 locations with a credit card minimum (cash only for slices). The other 3 locations don't have a minimum. I haven't been to the new Harrison street location yet to compare. Also the slices are less generous than what I get at the Haight street location.

The wall menu only has basic details, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/escape-from-new-york-pizza-san-francisco-5?select=rfW-W225JvzchUPnApraTQ#rfW-W225JvzchUPnApraTQ  get a copy of the menu for a complete list of pizza options and signature choices.

Hours: M-F 11:30am-midnight, Sat-Sun 11:30am-2am
Cash only for slices.
author: Luis C.

description:
Went here since it was down the street from my brother's place
Service was friendly.
Pizza was good and reasonably priced
Small pizza joint.
There was an order of pepperoni, combination, mushroom, and potato

Inside there's tons of pictures on the walls of different celebrities. . .I heard Matt Groeing comes here. . .niiiiice!
author: Remie M.

description: I ate a toasted slice of the plain cheese pizza. Crunchy crust, stretchy cheese, fresh tomato sauce, correct crust:sauce ratio, not too oily, and generally tastes fresh. I definitely will come here again to this random pizza store along 22nd Street between Mission Street & Valencia Street. Well done.
author: Susan T.

description:
I called this one in after getting back from Tahoe. When equal parts exhaustion and hunger get you, pizza is usually the result.

I've been wanting to try Escape since my honey had a slice at the Haight location, so I ordered off their website (free delivery) and within 40 or so minutes (slightly less actually) a friendly delivery guy dropped it off.

Service was great, pizza was super tasty (The potato garlic) and not dripping with grease.

Loved it and would definitely order from again!
author: Meg T.

description:
Oh, Escape from New York. You have been a part of my Friday nights twice now, and both after a very fun night out. I applaud you, and thank you for wrapping up my late nights/early mornings so well.

The pizza is very good. I particularly like the mushroom pizza. I also dig that they heat it up from you. Really sets it apart from heated by heat lamp pizza. For this, I thank you, EFNYP. 

The line can be long, but goes quickly. 

Sometimes you have to scour your fellow patrons for the parm or the chili flakes, but fear not, likely besotted customer: they are usually around.

The good: big slices, big attitudes, good price.
The bad: good luck getting into the bathroom.
author: Amanda B.

description: Came here after watching a band play jazz at revolution cafe . Since I was drunk and it was 11:45 pm I did not expect much but I left disappointed despite my low expectations. My pineapple pizza was soggy and had clearly been sitting for over an hour before it arrived. I understand that the place was busy but the manager should hire more people to handle busy nights, it's not rocket science.
author: Damon G.

description: Best pizza ever!!!! I love it and now my kids love it too!!! Everything on their crust is just perfect!! I recommend you to try!!
author: Rotem T.

description: pizza was great but the service i received from the disgruntled and older, heavy set gentleman was beyond rude. keep and eye on that one
author: John L.

description: Good pizza, short wait, and they toast the pizza before giving it to you rather than only using a heat lamp which I appreciated. Price was decent but there wasn't a lot of room to sit. Overall a good place to grab a slice of pizza.
author: Garrett S.

description: I am obsessed with their "you say potato" pizza. It's everything you could ask for, but I add a little more, sausage
author: A M.

description:
A solid 4 stars for the pizza.  We usually get roasted garlic cloves, balsamic drizzle, goat cheese, and sun-dried tomatoes but have tried other combos and have enjoyed it every time.

In addition to the tasty food, their delivery service is outstanding.  Always quick, their drivers are also exceptionally kind.  The last time I ordered, the driver apologized that he accidentally dropped the ranch that came with the buffalo wings but saw that there was a market nearby and picked up a whole bottle of ranch dressing for us.  Now that is service!
author: Chris T.

description:
I order delivery from here a lot. It's always hot*, the delivery person has always been friendly, and the prices are decent. I've bemoaned the fact that I can't find NY style pizza in this city, and TBH I wasn't expecting much but sure enough - it's actually fairly decent NYC pizza. Way to cure 50% of my homesickness, Escape from NY. 

*Actually hot! Not this lukewarm to cold pizza experience I've been cursed with from other places, but cheese sliding off the first inch of the center when you pick it up type of hot. That is my favorite thing that pizza does.
author: Christy S.

description: I love escape from new york pizza, but at this locate the cashier was very rude to me. I felt like they didnt want my business.  I work in retail too, so if i say hello or thank you its a courtesy to respond back, which did not happen. Very disappointed!
author: Jenell M.

description:
So this is my place when I want to stay home.They have a very big collection of items and top pings.The crust is good and they give you extra sauce (which I use to make my own pizzas)
It's delicious for delivery pizza.
author: Bob L.

description: The same great pizza I usually have at the Haight location, but in the Mission. I had a pesto and a cheese slice, and my boyfriend had a pepperoni and a pesto/garlic/rosemary potato slice - all were fantastic, AND they have fountain Cherry Coke. I love you, Escape From New York Pizza!!!
author: Mindy S.

description:
Excellent pizza!! I've tried several of their locations and this one is great. 
You can set up an account online and order food very easily. 
Delivery is quick and nice. 
I always request the pizza well done and it's always perfect. 
Don't forget the coupon to get a few bucks off.
author: Robert O.

description: This is my favorite little pizza restaurant.  The pizza is delicious, fresh, and it is not overly greasy like most places. I can actually eat the crust off the pizza here!  The only downside is that it is very small so there isn't much space to dine-in if you have a big crowd. The decor of the restaurant is filled with really cool photographs of all sorts of people and great posters which gives it its own character. Escape from New York pizza is hands down my go-to pizza place in the city!
author: Polett R.

description: Honestly, some of the best delivery pizza in the city. Always fresh and fast. If they deliver to you, give it a shot; its unlikely you'll be disappointed.
author: Ryan P.

description:
This was a delicious slice of San Francisco. After a long (6 mile) walk, I worked up quite an appetite. I popped in on a whim and saw the pizza by the slice looked great--large triangles of thin crust. I ordered a mushroom and cheese, finished that, then went back to order another w/ sausage. 

Nice neighborhood, great service, and a wall covered with celebrity endorsements that gives the place a sort of implied recommendation.
author: Matthew R.

description: Have had a few pies from EFNYP. Ho hum. But today I was passed by one of their delivery cars. The driver was flying, arm hanging from the car window, cigarette in hand. Was impressed by the authenticity. Seemed so NY. On the other hand, not real interested in a mushroom, garlic and nicotine pie.
author: k m.

description:
I'm not a big fan of pizza but trust me this place worth to try!! 

Hawaiian was great 
Chicken basil pizza was great

Yummy cheap and just easy good meal!! Recommended!!
author: Fah Z.

description:
Their pizzas are pretty much the same as chain pizza shops like Dominos.  It's just whatever.  Getting them by the slice is horribly pricey, and definitely escape from new york because new york pizzas of this quality are much cheaper by the slice.

Eating in is not the best experience, since the shop is tiny and feels dirty.  Customer service is not great either.  We got a takeout once and they forgot our sauce, after we repeatedly ask for them to include.

There are way better options out there.
author: Loretta H.

description: The pizza is phenomenal, and they deliver, but it's a little outrageous how expensive it gets. We ordered one extra large pizza (some sort of meat and veggie combo) and it came out to $40 for delivery. Seemed a bit high to me, but it was super delicious.
author: Amy Y.

description:
My bf and I stopped into Escape From New York Pizza after a night of going out with a few friends in the Mission. We had eaten at Rosamunde earlier and decided we were still in the mood for more food. The pizza here is good, thin crust with cool flavors, but what really stood out to me, was the service provided to us by Martin. He has SUCH positive energy for working late (1am or so) on a Thursday night. He was so helpful and nice, and it was entirely unexpected from a joint like this. I even decided to have my boyfriend ask for his name when we left so I'd be sure to yelp about it later.

HIP HIP HORRAY FOR MARTIN! (Attn management: he deserves a raise!)
author: Eliza F.

description:
The service is better than the pizza, but the pizza is pretty darn good. The staff are friendly and sassy and funny to talk with. I usually laugh aloud a couple of times chatting with them.
The pesto/garlic/potato is killer. I think the balsamic/fig is good, but it sounds more exciting than it tastes. The meat combo delivers. 
It's a big slice of pizza for about $4-5. Not the cheapest, but good quality.
author: Sam Z.

description:
Pretty bomb pizzas. Open late night, right around the bar crowd which makes it perfect to walk, eat, then enjoy the rest of the night.

Had the meat lovers, had sausage pepperoni, also tried some of the pesto which came with garlic and other things which was pretty good too.

Little pricey for just a slice of pizza, but you get a big slice.. 

We were visiting SF for the weekend so the dude working up front had good recommendations for pizza and bars around the area which was a plus.
author: Kenny I.

description: I'll admit I was a little too buzzed to be a reliable critic of pizza. But when I asked for a side of ranch and paid fifty cents for it I expected it to be included in my order. Maybe the guy at the counter was buzzing too..but I had to ask for the ranch again. What is pizza without a side of ranch?
author: Jacqueline O.

description: This is my kid's favorite pizza. [+1 star.] But today I want to give them a review.  Sometimes days are tough, nothing really bad happens, but we all have days where cooking when you get home is not going to happen. Uncorking some wine is going to happen, but cooking is not. So, I called up Escape and placed my order, even if I sounded a bit incoherent he patiently took it while I fumbled. I wish it ended there, but of course there was still the issue of picking it up. (Next time I'll go Delivery to spare them and it's great that they offer it.). They had my order cooking when I got there, b/c honestly, the way I sounded I probably wouldn't have.  [+2stars.].  They take my slice order cuz I don't have the energy to pick off anything off a slice to make it "cheese" for the littles. [+3stars. ] I was feeling the music they had, because it reminded me a simpler time in life[ +4 stars]. I momentarily forgot how to speak English and didn't understand my pizza was ready and instead thought he was giving me a pizza with "peppers and Parmesan cheese."  And I said, "No!" And then realized he was offering the condiments. Guys showed no judgment when I fessed up that I was really "out of it!" And approached to take my pizza order. The guy at the register said confirmed that we all have "one of those days." Yes sir, this is one of "those" (+5 stars]. Good pizza (and wine) does make make it better.  (I swear I drank the wine after visiting your fine establishment.) Thank you for prepping dinner.
author: Maricela L.

description:
Super good pizza and nice big slices. They have a good deal for a meal - a slice of pizza, a salad, and a drink for $8. I ordered the pesto chicken pizza, yum. Good crust-to-toppings ratio. Cool atmosphere with tons of pictures on the walls. The staff was cordial - not overly friendly but not rude either. 

I haven't tried many other pizza places in the Mission so I can't give it the Yelp 5 star "As good as it gets!" but it's pretty darn good. I'd definitely come here again.
author: Dena E.

description: I stopped in 2 years ago for quarters and always made it a point to comeback and today I did. One thing I have to say is wish I had come sooner. The pizza here is a masterpiece it's not like your average pizza place. This is top quality for a great price. Great customer service and great pizza. I had the pesto potato and garlic pizza.
author: Macario G.

description: The home of the five dollar slice.  The cheese and vegetable weren't even cooked and the sausage was dry and gross.  This place is beyond bad, including the name itself.  Over priced and undercooked.  Don't bother wasting your time or money here.
author: Zach H.

description:
by comparison to all other late-night Pizza places in San Francisco, EFNY deserves 5-stars. No question. 

If I was back in New York, or talking about "gourmet" pizza, or sit-down joints during normal business hours, maybe not 5, but close. 

But when it comes to EFNY, it's my favorite late night place without a line (sorry Grubstake)
author: Mike V.

description:
This was not good at all!

I'm vegetarian and I ordered the potato pizza. After eating one slice, I bit into the second slice to find a piece of meat in my mouth. 

I called to complain and they put me on hold for 5 minutes. The manager then came on and when I told him about my problem, he goes "That makes sense, the sausage is near the garlic so that can happen." Not even a sorry. He then told me that he could send me a new pizza, yet when I told him I didn't want another pizza, I wanted a refund, he said no.

Never again will I order from here.
author: Sanskriti A.

description: Decent slice. If Yelp let us do half-stars, I'd probably give it 3.5, but I'll be generous. It doesn't particularly stand out for any reason, but I don't have any complaints either. It stays open pretty late, so that's convenient. I'm sure I'll be back.
author: Adam N.

description: Such good pizza!!! Open super late and right across from the bar the Make Out Room!!! There was a line when I went but it went by super quickly. The only thing that caused me to give this place 4 stars instead of 5 is the price. One slice is almost $4.50-5.00..... Kinda steep....Overall delicious pizza for those late night munchies!
author: Sandra C.

description: I used to work at a particular chain pizza place in Georgia so I tend to avoid most pizza now in general, but after my boyfriend ordered the Applewood bbq chicken pie? I died. Then we tried the Super Combo and omg. I tried another delivery place nearby and it wasn't the same. Escape tops their pies generously, uses hella fresh ingredients, is quick, and the delivery crew is outstandingly nice. The Liberty salad is simple and amazingly good as well. Since I moved to the Mission, this is the only place I trust for damn good pizza. I can't think of any other place that uses chicken so damn...well it ain't the bagged kind, I guarantee that. So yummy. Don't forget to tip your delivery crew. Those people work their butts off, you know.
author: Rebecca P.

description: My friend really talked this place up, however they screwed up our order (we ordered one of their signature pizzas - garlic, basil, and Canadian bacon).  They used mushrooms instead of Canadian bacon.  Unacceptable.
author: Heather S.

description: Finally found a place that sells by the slice and is actually good! Loved the cheese pizza, I Got there at 10pm with a friend and we were served right away and the pizza was HOT yum! Plenty of parking, provided that the club across the street is not open or is slow (we went on a Sunday). It was my friends first time and she loved it she said she would be coming back. Yay! No pics this time, I forgot and just scarfed it down. :/ next time my friends...
author: Libby D.

description: My go-to spot when I get the drunk munchies after a night out in the mission. It's a small spot with just a few tables, and they sell pizza by the slice that they toast before handing to you. The potato and garlic one is delicious!! The garlic leaves a STRONG smell and taste in your mouth though so beware if you're on a date haha
author: Cat M.

description:
Dough has no taste. Ordered a Combo; toppings are tasteless. Xxtra mushrooms? = almost no mushrooms. 

Blehhhh... Nothing negatively personal about any employees or anything, just not good pizza.
author: Hazel H.

description: Best pizza outside of New York!!  Love the staff here!  They are super friendly.  Thank you, Chelsea, for the wonderful quick service and tasty pizza!
author: Belle P.

description:
Very middle of the road.
* Great friendly service. They really care about making good pizza. 
* Awesome parklet for dining in the street. 
* C'mon, seriously?  You couldn't sell this pizza in NYC or Rome. Nobody would buy it.  Why is there chunks of garlic in my pizza margarite?  Having trouble sourcing cheese with body, flavor, or tang?

Writing this review is the first time I've missed NY since I left 13 years ago.
author: Ivan L.

description:
Not bad, but nothing to dream about. I had a pesto slice. Tasty and filling. I did really like the crust - chewy and buttery. Decent slice options like pepperoni, sundried tomato/artichoke, a chicken one, and probably another 1-2 options. Definitely does the job if you are craving pizza. I'd eat here again if I was near one and wanted a slice, but probably would not seek it out.

The Mission location is small inside, but there looks to be outdoor seating which would be nice on a sunny day. Service is friendly.
author: Veronica H.

description:
I  often grab a late night slice here.  If you get one that's fresh, it's pretty decent, and close to authentic NY- style.

But the other night, there was only one cheese slice laying there, and it looked pretty tired.  So I ordered a large pie to go.

When it was ready, the cashier says $22.72.  I said, "How did you get that?  It says $18.95 on the menu."

He shows me the receipt where he added it up on one register to get $20.75, and then pushes a button on another register which comes to $22,72.  

I said, "Don't you see?  You're charging me twice for the tax."
He says, "I don't know anything about that.  This is how we do things here."

We started arguing, go around in circles.  Finally, someone else came over and rang it up, and it came to $20.75.   They were pretty irritated with me for making a stink about it.  Fuck them.  I'll take my business somewhere else next time.

Moral:  Be sure to double check your bill when you order from this place.
author: Gene C.

description: Decent pizza. I recommend the pesto and meat slice! Probably some of the better pizza I've had since I moved here from NYC.
author: Cory N.

description: They have a variety of pizza cominations at this place. They had a pesto slice and one with potatoes which I thought was cool. I wasn't feeling very adventurous at the time so I ordered a slice of pepperoni. It was your average slice of pie other than the price which was $3+. In addition, they charge 50 cents extra for ranch! Needless to say, I would probably would not go back to Escape for pizza in the future.
author: Missy A.

description: Whats not to love about EFNY? The sell a good slice, at a good price, at mostly all hours, and hand you a slice with a smile? That's a winning combo!
author: Vivek N.

description:
Escape from New York Pizza can facilitate an escape from leftovers during lunch, while being helplessly barricaded indoors by the gently falling rain.

The swirl of fresh toppings, grease spillage, and mild pesto flavoring on the Andy Warhol create a worthy candidate to satisfy last-minute pizza cravings during work.  The crust is aptly baked crispy and chewy, and the cheese, despite its tendency to slide off during each bite, is not too salty.

This location provides prompt delivery.  All payment, including tip, pizza modifications (toppings on only half the pie), and special instructions to guide the delivery to a hard-to-find location can all be handled online, providing a quick and clean transaction of just the pizza at the door!

Note: Do take advantage of the 20% off for making an online account to order.
author: Andrew M.

description:
This is delivery pizza - it's good for that. They deliver pretty fast, overall,  and the people are either nice, or at least not rude.
I wish it was faster, given it's proximity to me, but whatever.
I love all kinds of pizza. For delivery pizza, I'm looking for simple, hot, and flat. I'm sure there's a joke in there somewhere, but i will try to stay on topic.
based on my criteria, it's the best delivery pizza I've had, based on multiple pies from multiple places over the course of a number of months.
author: Charlie H.

description:
I have no idea what I would think of this place if I wasn't vegan, but, I am vegan so fuck that. This place serves up vegan pizza with vegan daiya cheese (for those of you who don't know, this is the yummiest soy cheese out on the market). When I had this pizza delivered, it was yummy and on time. When I got this pizza to go, it was yummy and took 10 (!!!) minutes from when I called until when it was ready. When I ate this pizza there, it was yummy and the staff were super friendly and sweet.

 The price is a little high (for the vegan cheese, that is), but what else is new? In my dreamworld, growing beans and processing them into a cheese-like something will cost less than growing a cow, milking it, and processing that milk into cheese. But this isn't my dream world, and EFNY isn't to blame. Hoorah for pizza covered in a cheese-like something!
author: Devin F.

description: Food of the God's!!! The cook was awesome, Should have got her name for the review.  Excellent customer services  place is small but a nice environment.  The place is eclectic but matches the setting and the neighborhood.  The music was perfect and a nice compliment to the scene.  i recommend a slice of pizza with shrooms. This is a Great place to grab a slice of pizza and hang out a bit. Again Aces to the cook!!
author: Joseph M.

description:
4 maybe 4.5 stars for the slices... and another +1 star for the incredible service. i know it's just a little sit-in or takeout shop but let me explain. 

the slices here are just as you'd expect from a place named "escape from new york" because they are pretty darn close to the real thing in manhattan. nice piping hot, wide slices with a not too thick/not too thin crust that has a perfect balance of crispness and chewy give with every bite. i've had several different kinds here, but you really can't go wrong with anything. mid-day to middle of the night, these slices will not let you down. 

as for the +1 star, i accidentally left my purse here late one night -- completely filled with all my precious belongings -- and was sure that either a petty thief passing by would have a superlucky night making off with it, or someone would simply steal all the cash, cards, etc from my wallet and rip off some of the nicer things i happened to be carrying with me that night, including my shiny new smartphone. but NO. the guys working here somehow managed to call my husband and let him know that they found my purse and would keep it in their safe until i came to reclaim it! it was like having an angel. small good deeds to fellow mankind... paying it forward... good karma... whatever you want to call it. 

i showed up to get my purse and the guys were so incredibly nice, friendly, and professional. they saved my life!

if they didn't have good pizza, i still might feel obligated/guilted into buying slices from them in the future. but lucky for me, they also happen to be a rock solid pizza joint.

THANK YOU EFNY in the MISSION!
author: M. M.

description: The only thing New York about this place is the name and the prices.  How do you manage to make a tasteless pizza?  I don't even think I can do as bad.  I do like that they are open late but they never have fresh slices.  Most stuff looks like its been sitting around for a few hours.
author: Mitch A.

description:
I'm taking an 8-weekend course at the Valencia CCSF, and being across the street from EFNY, I've been eating here pretty much every week, and ITS GREAT. its fast, cheap and delicious, what else can you ask for?? 

try the pesto garlic potato, sausage pepperoni & bell pepper, and the one with the chicken is good too. working on my loyalty punch card for my free slice. woohooo
author: Jennie L.

description: so not work 5$ for one slice! it was not that great. the cheese was still hard and the dough is hard. maybe i just got a bad batch but its still not worth 5$ a slice when you can go to the spot across from phils coffee on 24th for 3$ a slice.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
I originally planned to write a review for this place earlier this year. It went something like this....

I am stoked that Escape From New York has a location in the Mission. I have a choice every Tuesday evening during the school semester to either gorge on pizza, Popeye's Chicken, or a Big Mouth Burger! My junk food trifecta within a one block radius every Tuesday!!

My favorite slice at Escape is the You Say Potato. The pesto sauce and roasted garlic cloves will assure you to reek of pizza for the rest of the day. They kinda need to put more pesto sauce on the pizza because it's a little dry.

But, they also give out a redeemable stamp card to receive a free slice of pizza after your seventh slice. Woohoo!

Now that the semester has ended I feel like I've had my fill of Escape From New York Pizza. I'll still go for a slice if I'm around one of their locations but I will not go out of my way to visit.

Darn, one stamp away from a free slice!

*Shove card back into wallet with other stamp cards*
author: Sam T.

description: After eating the very overpriced and soggy pizza at Escape all I could think about is how I actually want to run back to New York and have good pizza.
author: Priscilla M.

description: Should went somewhere else, it is a chain, with no Internet.... Yet a WiFi signal.... I mean the spot next to me is a Internet cafe.., just not feeling it..... Maybe it's the smell of pot in the air & hippies everywhere
author: Grant S.

description:
A weak link in a GREAT chain.  The slices are smaller (though the same price) and not nearly as tasty than at the other branches, and the person who took my order was mean.  How mean do you have to be in a quiet pizza place on a sunny weekday afternoon?  

They don't take plastic, which is not the biggest deal because no one does in the Mission, but there other branches do.  Oooh, this branch is so Mission hip....
author: Jack M.

description:
Pizza is thin and pretty satisfying when you want to have a cheap dinner. I actually like this place significantly more than Goat Hill Pizza in Potrero (which I live next to). Better than that overhyped Pizza Orgasmica as well. Honestly, I'd probably only rate it a 3.5... but it's one of my more favorite pizza places in the city so it deserves a 4.

I tried the famous potato pizza and haven't really liked it, but I'm more of a simple cheese pizza kind of person. Cheese pizza here is great. Food comes out piping hot and fast. Plus for the more frugal diner, there are punch cards with a free slice after you meet the quota (can't remember off the top of my head what it is).
author: Sylvia L.

description: Whether on a drunken Friday night or an icy Saturday evening, you can always expect an excellent slice of pizza from Escape From New York Pizza. The pesto, potato pizza is to-die-for! The price is very reasonable and it's in the heart of Castro. Stop here for a slice of pizza-wonderfulness
author: Andersen Y.

description:
I ordered a late-night 'za from Escape from New York last night, and despite the amount of beer coursing through my veins I was reluctant to have this pizza anywhere near my belly.
Though it came on time after 25 minutes via friendly delivery guy, it was a subpar pie.  The thing was totally undercooked with shreds of cheese maintaining their pre-melted shape and not a hint of browning anywhere.  The sausage they used was sliced crap that tasted like a hot dog.  
Even after 10 minutes at 450 degrees, I had to douse the slices with hot sauce just to get them down.  The leftovers?  In the compost bin- a place this food would actually be enjoyed by someone.
author: Eric S.

description:
It's late, you've been drinking, and now find your stomach empty and in need of carbs to soak some of the night up - go to Escape.

It's lunch you're lazy and walking through the Mission, want some decent fresh pizza with Ranch - go to Escape. 

It's anytime and you want pretty edible pizza, you're not looking for the all-time slice, just something with good sauce, and cheese, the basics done right - go to Escape. 

There's a lot to be said for offering something reliable and consistent. It may not ring bells and get all experimental and have some obscure Mission foodie journal writing it up, but it gets the pizza-craving job done. Nuff said.
author: Kelly S.

description: I love eating here. This is one of the only pizza places I will go to. My favorite is the pesto pizza. The staff are really cool and it's overall a chill environment.
author: Cecilia G.

description: I've had better pizza from Elio's - you know the crap your mom pulled out of a cardboard box and unfroze in the toaster while you watched the afternoon special. I ordered the vegan pie and ended up giving away to drifters who hang out in the Revolution Cafe parklette - they seemed disappointed too. The other oddity was that the vegan pie doesn't come with any veggies on it. If you happen to be looking for a good vegan slice try out Mystic or Paxti's
author: Ken F.

description: Well, I wasn't sure if I could finish a slice of very salty cheese pizza. I wounder how could you make that pizza so salty. I will order Hawaiian if you have one next time. :)
author: Vicki S.

description: The Pizza itself is delicious... and I hardly ever give out 1 star, but man customer service here seems to not be enforced .. I came in here and one of the guys in the back made me feel so dumb and was so rude and miserable , geez... I am not one to talk down about anyones job, working at a pizza place could be super duper stressful I imagine , but jeez atleast be nice..the food left a good taste in my mouth but the service didnt !
author: Mariangeles C.

description: The potato and garlic pizza is good but somewhat heavy and a little greasy. If you're looking for a quick bite and large portion in the mission, I would recommend coming here!
author: Kat P.

description:
This is the first place I ate upon moving to San Francisco, largely because they were the only place open and delivering past 9:30 in my neighborhood. 

I don't know if this is a San Francisco thing or not, but this pizza is expensive. The pizza itself tastes okay but is nothing remarkable. First go round I got pepperoni, the crust pretty much has no flavor so I didn't bother eating it. Second time I got one of the BBQ chicken pizzas, which I think was put together by someone stoned out of their mind because all the bacon was heaped in one corner, and the chicken in another, so some slices didn't even have toppings on them. Also strangely the toppings were cut into enormous pieces, kind of unmanageable. 

What I will say though is the delivery guys for this place are awesome. They are so friendly, above and beyond really, also accommodating as I asked them to call instead of ringing my doorbell so my dog wouldn't bark. They always say the pizza will take an hour but it seems to show up in about 35 minutes, so that's nice. 

Will probably order again because it's easy and nearby, but there's nothing special about this pizza.
author: Beth D.

description: This place has average quality pizza. I primarily have gone here because it is open late or if I just really need a quick snack. Prices are slightly above average in size and price. Normally if I want delivery I recommend Extreme Pizza or Zantes (home of the amazing Indian pizza).
author: Ben U.

description:
I dont know why I continue to order from this place, Im always disappointed. Tonight was the last straw - 

Ordered delivery (large cheese with 1/2 meatballs) and the meatballs were obviously forgotten until the pizza was already boxed. 

Whoever was cooking then just slapped some over-saucy meatballs on top of a cooked cheese pizza - so that when you picked up a slice, they plopped right off. and it looked completely disgusting and unappetizing. For cripes' sake - throw some cheese on top of the meatballs and throw it back in the oven for 5 minutes!
author: gina p.

description:
I'm only giving this place four stars instead of five because my experience might have been skewed from a night of fun - but regardless I'm surprised to see so many weak reviews of the pizza here!   

It's NY style, and though we (hopefully) all know that there's no duplicating the real deal, this was a good homage with a distinct Cali take.

My eyes immediately went to the sausage, pepperoni, peppers and onions pie - all my fave toppings - but when I saw what my friend Cathy ordered I had to switch it up. Roasted red potatoes (sliced), roasted garlic cloves, and pesto sauce...B-O-M-B!!  My taste buds screamed for another slice, but my my brain knew the stomach was maxed out. Yummmm
author: Andrew Z.

description:
My roommate told me that this place had some bomb pizza.  I wanted to like it. I really did.  But I should have known better; for the last week the man has eaten nothing but King Cobra and a block of brie his gf bought him.

It would be really convenient to have a great pizza place so close to the bars, BART, city college. etc.  I was hesitant that the sight of the place - but hey, I'll give it a chance.  It was a little too reminiscent of the Blondie's-style pizza in Berkeley that's made in the morning and only good at ungodly hours.  And I'm sure EFNY could save a drunk tummy at such a time.  But noon on a Thursday, it was underwhelming.

I can't say I'll never return, but I swear my sober belly will not be ingesting it again.  wink wink.  obvious lame joke.
author: Mari C.

description:
I remember when there used to be an Escape from New York Pizza downtown many many years ago. I remember I REALLY liked their pizza. That was probably the first place I ever saw green (pesto) pizza. It amazed me when I was little.

But years have gone by and I have grown up as has my expectation for pizza. I have discovered so many amazing pizza places since those childhood days that takes away from Escape from New York special-ness in my heart. 

I ordered a medium, 14" pizza, half Hawaiian and half 'you say potato'. It was around $20-$21 dollars, a little much for pizza. It fed three of us well. They charged extra for making it half-half. Understandable, but does not make me happy. I stuck to my veggie garlic potato half and I liked it. It had lots of garlic, which is awesome. 

They do sell pizza by the slice too, but I didn't think one slice was going to fill me up.

Overall the pizza was good, nothing to flock here for, but good pizza if you are in the area.
author: Angela T.

description:
At the risk of sounding not fashionably jaded & anti-establishment enough to live in the Mission, Escape From New York makes perfectly functional pizza.

I know, I know - it's not all hip & trendy & indy & shit, but whatevs.  There are a metric fuck ton of other pizza places I'd go first if I wanted Really Good Pizza, but sometimes you're starving, you want food in your belly, you want to be able to walk there, and you don't want to have to think too hard about it.  On those nights, I'll definitely bop on over to EFNY.  As chains go, they are in my opinion one of the least offensive options out there.

A bit overpriced (like $4 a slice) & slices are cash only (there's an ATM in the store), but that's about the worst I can say about it.  EFNY is pretty much the definition of 3 stars.
author: Angela B.

description:
NEED A ESCAPE TO GET OUT OF THIS HORRIBLE PLACE!!!

If you saw reviews that says that they love Escape from New York, do note that probably most of them were probably drunk or high while or before eating here! This place is no way near being the best pizza place at all in SF. I'm trying to escape from eating here, but I couldn't. If Snake from the movie ate here, he would too try to escape and failed. This escape is a disappointment.

Techinally half of the customers that do go here are probably smoke way way too much J's or drunk way way too much to remember what great food taste like.

The only pizza dish I could say was great, was the Potatoe and Garlic. It's sometimes call 'You say Potato'.What's with the silly names: 'U say Potato' should be known as Garlic and Potato Pizza. There are others such as 'Elementary My Dear Watsonville'. That pizza is a Artichokes and Tomatoes. What's wrong with calling it, an Artichokes and Tomatoes Pizza?What's a 'Andy Warhol', do I really want to find out? Isn't Andy Warhol known as the guy who got shot by a crazy drug addict model girlfriend? What's with these stupid gimmick names?! If you call it a different title, couldn't they have thought of a easier name than that. Why are they calling their pizzas, pies? It's confusing as hell.
The pesto pizza is dry.Pesto Pizza based on the menu are not found in New York, huh?Normal cheese pizza might be undercooked. There is really nothing remarkable about them at all. They might look good, but my taste buds don't say the same.

The next thing on the list: 3 dollars for one slice of pizza that had little taste. The place is expensive. Waste of good money. Yes, they do free fast delivery and you do have the choice of making your own combination pizzas, good salads, but it's still sucks. The soda 12.oz can for 1.15 is a rip off. 

Now the location: there is a lot of 'celebrity' autographs and photos on the wall, that looks cool. The guitar in the case is tight. I give them props for that. The location only has three table inside. The staff look at me as if I was a fly, pesting around. I got my food and pay, but they act like I was just loitering around. The bathroom are unisex, ok in San Francisco standrads: meaning glass carving of names and semi clean toilet. There is a key where the staff has to open it.

Cash only in this place, good wheelchair ramp, and you can get a Pizza Punch Card where you get the 8th slice for free.

Over view: if you not riding 420, you will probably feel like eating something else.
author: Ivy V.

description:
OK. The pizza here is bad. The crust is bad. The sauce is bad. This place sucks. 

Sure, it's good when you are drunk. But... you know, when you're blitzed enough, any old vodka tastes good. Safeway special? Sure, no problem. Until the next day, praying next to your toilet, you realize what a clueless asswipe you are when drunk. So please, to the "it's the perfect drunkfood" crowd... rehydrate yourselves and consider what you are saying.

To the freakazoids who are dissin' Serrano's pizza -  which, for those of you not in the hood, is only one block away  - you totally confuse me. Really. Perhaps you have never cooked yourself before, and don't really know what cooking good food entails. I suppose in comparing local pizza-by-the-slice establishments, the palates are not particularly refined?

Serrano's has fresh ingredients, they bake each slice from scratch, the sauce is great, the crust is great. My cred: I grew up in a college town near Chicago, where pizza is a religion, and I was a very dedicated disciple. Serrano's is not intentionally hip. *Hip people may go there,* but it's just a pizza place that is doing everything right. Jesus, I've had *way* more pretentious pizza in this town - Pauline's, anyone? - but Serrano's? No. In fact, they were so unhip, they went through a phase of handing out little cards that pushed a real estate biz one of the owners had on the side. Yeah, if you closed a deal with him, you got like $300 worth of pizza or something. It was hilarious. Did I give a shit? No. Their pizza is classic and perfect.

I was happy with Serrano's being the only pizza place in this neck of the woods. I considered myself fortunate. If EFNY forces them out of business, we as a city will have reached a level of lameness I previously thought unattainable.

I suggest you program Serrano's # into whatever crazy-assed thing you are using as a phone, and when you get the urge for quick pizza, take a deep breath, dial, and wait the extra 10 minutes. It's worth it.
author: Dusty R.

description:
Friend and I took a break from having our ear drums gangbanged by live music at the Make-Out Room and stumbled drunkenly into this pizza joint.

My friend's an SF resident, while I'm a native but live in Oakland--oh boy, just watch as the hijinks unfurl!

No, not really.  The hijinks tend to spring forth from this little nugget--I drink like a fish and she doesn't, so I weave back and forth with a lamp shade on my head and she shakes hers in bemused disdain.

Hey, it's our friendship and it works--you know what you can do with your judgment!

Anyway, pizza here was pretty decent--I especially like the medium-thick but extra-crispy crust.  Their sauce wasn't anything special, however.  Kind of that bright red semi-sweet that's a little too close to commercial.  Good selection of the usual toppings and condiments (parm, pepper, garlic salt, etc).

Brought me down from my bourbon high, so that was good.
author: Martin W.

description: Meat Lovers had more vegetables on it than meat....how is that? I ordered two large. Meat lovers pizzas for $65 and it had more onions and peppers on it then meat. We had it delivered while visiting a friend...never again! Fast delivery is only positive experience.
author: David S.

description:
YES! Big time fan, been going to the one on Haight before this, I like this location better, less busy and rarely running out my flavor I always get to the Haight one when they run out of [U SAY POTATO] and  easier parkin' and stuff.

The POTATO PIZZA alone gives this place a FIVE STAR. Where else do you see potato as a topping [let me know if you know] Has thin crust pesto sauce and these baked garlic cloves that makes it the best.

They also have the Pizza Punch Card where the 8th slice is FREE! I just love it when places has these. 

Definitely worth trying, I'm not too fond of the other flavors, the five stars is just for the U SAY POTATO!! Get a slice before you die.

DELTA's: Cash Only, A teeny more pricier than your average pizzaria

I say Potato you say Potato
author: Raphael A.

description:
good fast slice place! 

I enjoyed the thin and crispy crust. Not as greasy as other places. 

They have an interesting slice with pesto, potatoes and whole cloves of roasted garlic. 

Solid place and guys that work there are nice and friendly!
author: Yva D.

description:
Average tasting pizza; portion of the slice is large but I didn't expect to eat this pizza after a detour made to Heirloom Cafe (since it was closed for lunch during the weekend).  

I think it was about $4.50/slice. 

Some seating area and right next to Lolo and Revolution Cafe.
author: Jboogie L.

description:
You know what you're getting - a solid, large slice of kinda-almost-New York-Style for a bit more money than it should be, conveniently, and fast.  Not enough places sell that in San Francisco, so I do go back.  

Their Potato and Garlic slice is by far their best.

They deliver efficiently, and are open relatively late.
author: Zachary R.

description:
this place doesn't except CC's on single slices, which sounds like they accept for whole pizzas.  Well it was my fault, but the 3$ atm fee at the scammy wells fargo for 2 x 3$ slices just made me grumpy.

Also the wheel chair ramp takes up like 50% of the interior of the store which made the already small space feel more cramped , and made me sort of irrationally resent wheelchair people.  

There were a swarm of big black juicy flies flying around inside.  
And inside the parmesan jar there was a fly buzzing around.  Makes me imagine that it grew right out of the freaking cheese (like sprinkle some cheese + larvae onto your slices, i imagine the refills come from the same maggot ridden container)

It was hard to eat the good tasteing slice and not be paranoid about some big kamikaze fly (made fat on the abundant dog shit in the mission) making a beeline(ha ha,a fly making a beeline)  right for my mouth.

Sounds like i didn't have a very good experience right?  Then why did i give this place 3 stars?   "A-OK"
well, cause it is only a block away from where i live. Wwhich makes me never have to make the mistake of going to that awful Serrano's again.  That place is just terrible.  I'd rather have a fly go directly from a juicy dog (or human) turd into my mouth than ever have to degrade my palate with one of those piece of crap Serrano's triangle carboard things again.  

I don't get why these smelly hipsters Serrano's so much, it sucks, so much. Jesus Christ. it might be the worst pizza in the city.  Which leads me to believe it must have something to do with the hipster culture.  Not the taste of the pizza.  They must have got together at one of their weekly meetings around their drum circles and decided it would be ironic to keep this Serrano's pizza in business.  Like that time they came up with the bright idea of protesting and blocking the opening of the American Apparel.  That sure was cool and ironic you assholes, American Apparel is all you wear, lets run it out of town, cause empty store fronts are so much hipper.  

Anyway, Arinelle's is still my favorite, but if i had to get a pizza within a block of home, i will go to escape from new york.  i just won't use the parmesan.
author: Irvin S.

description: I am a huge fan of Escape From NY. I work less than a block away at Wix, and I try and hit it up at least once a week. "You Say Potato" is an amazing slice of pizza! I usually get one of those and one pepperoni. Never been disappointed. The staff is always exceptionally friendly!!
author: Chase L.

description:
Stoked that Escaped from New York Pizza now has a location in the Mission! Just had a slice of the gourmet with art hearts, sun-dried tomatoes, spinach and red sauce. It was fresh, pipping hot and cooked to perfection. The crust was thin, crisp and just a tad sweet. Quality.

They're open until 2AM on the weekends, making it one of the few late night eateries around this part of town that's not a taqueria. You now have a choice Missionites!

Welcome to the neighborhood Escape from New York Pizza! Glad you're here!
author: Trevar M.

description:
Golly. The reviews are all over the place. It amuses me. What can I say. I work a block away from this place, and sometimes I need to grab a quick slice. This place serves up a solid piece of pie for $4. Plus, there's a frequent diner card. Oh yes. I will be frequently dining there. 

I don't know New York pizza, so I can't comment on whether the place lives up to its name. But the service is always friendly, the reheat is fast (and thorough -- no lukewarm slices yet), and the tables outside are great for soaking up some sun and enjoying your slice. I don't recognize half the "celebrity" photos on their wall, and this just adds to the charm.

For the record, I like me some fancy-pants gourmet pizza. Pauline's, and Pizzetta are my favorites for that. (Not a huge fan of Gialina's.) But sometimes you just want a slice. In which case, I will happily add EFNY to the list also occupied by Marcello's, Golden Boy, and Irving St. pizza (which is admittedly best eaten hot).
author: Jessica K.

description: Was only been here once, and happened to catch a very fresh veggie-artichoke pizza, which was DELICIOUS! And I'm not a big pizza fan.
author: O K.

description: How far they have fallen. This is all I can really say about a chain who used to be synonymous with San Francisco pizza culture. The prices have gone up $2 a pie on average within the last two years while the quality has plummeted. Adding insult to injury, EFNY has also reduced coupon amounts by a dollar. The last two pies I have ordered have been received lukewarm. This is no way to run a business and there are far too many pizza locations to settle for mediocrity. I challenge the owners to justify the increase in prices, decrease in quality, and delivering pies that are not even hot.
author: Kenny G.

description: Sigh.  Here's the thing: EFNYP is good to eat.  I won't ever say otherwise.  However, the customer service leaves so much to be desired, it's hard to make eating this slice palatable.  I've said it before, I LOVE pizza.  i will endure a lot to get the good stuff.  But frankly, if you want to treat me like an idiot when I call, there are so many other choices.  Let's try to remember that delivery pizza, while not glamorous, is a job that requires a willingness to partner with customers and demonstrate goodwill.  If you don't want to do that, I know it's a tough economic climate, but don't use that as a reason to be an asshole.
author: Ciara W.

description:
Perfect pizza for holding down the liquor sloshing around your belly after a night of drinking.  Right next door to the Revolution Cafe.  You can sit outside at a table, although you might get accosted by a homeless person.

They are open very late and I love them for this.
author: Aaron T.

description:
Wow - the power of convenience.  I went back.

My slice was good.  Not great. Not fantastic.  Just ... good. 

I still wish for:
-- lower price
-- better cheese
-- beers

The slice was solidly ... good.   Which is progress.
author: mario w.

description:
I have had their pizza twice in the past week and it's pretty good! First I had the pepperoni a few days ago and that was a-ok. Today I went ahead and tried the potato pizza and it was gooooooood! Even after I picked off all the garlic, I can't talk to anyone for the rest of the day cause of my stinky breath! But it was so gooood and so worth it!  

Yummy, fast, and cheap (I paid cash!)!
author: Valerie A.

description:
Deeeeee-licious!!

i am boggled by the lukewarm reviews, because i love this pizzaria. It's funny, because this is the only one in the city that i really enjoy, and i have been to many of the others.

My current fave is the sliced sausage, onion and bell pepper one they rock. It's all bad for you but not as greasy as the pepperoni, and on all of the sauced slices, their tomato sauce is just the kind of tangy-yummy i love.

It's like a weird combo of McDonald's and thee Parkside bar, lots of punkrock and music signage, and lots of really creepyish chrome and what looks like formica, and tile. Of course, the autographed stuff is really neat; i saw an old Flipper album cover signed that i have not thought of in years. Too expensive, yes, but i still go.
author: XTA s.

description:
Glad to see a pizza place open at 1am in the Mission. There is nothing better than buzzed late night junk food. After Lisa W. scared me away from eating bacon wrapped hot dogs from the street vendors, I was glad to find Escape from New York Pizza still filled with people and warm pizza for me! It was definitely an escape from the douche-cake crowd and the whack douchey DJ at Medjool. That potato pizza was delish. 

Mmmmmmm....just 3 stars. Why? I know I could grab better pizza some place else and its probably only good while buzzed. hahah

Recommednations: 
Slice of "YOU SAY POTATO"
Slice of "THE GOURMET"
author: Lisa T.

description: As somebody from New Jersey, I can say confidently this is the real deal. Awesome pizza. By the slice, warmed up served on two paper plates. Perfect.
author: Tim P.

description:
I've always liked their pizza so when I had to order lunch for a large group I was excited to find that they deliver at noon and that I could order online in advance with the ability to specify what time/date I wanted the pizza to arrive.

I'm giving their online ordering service one star.  Don't do it unless you want a big hassle.

The ordering interface is actually very user friendly but it was the follow up that really sucked.

- The morning of the ordered delivery I called to confirm that the pizzas were going to be delivered on time.  At first they couldn't find my order and only after searching for a while did they find it.  I hung up feeling pretty sure that if I had not called to double check my order would not have arrived.

- During the confirmation call I asked if they could deliver a little before noon (the time I had requested for my online order) they said they would try, but they were sure they would make it by the noon delivery....They showed up after 12:30.

- I ordered three pies from their specialty combos on their menu.  One of those combos was their vegetarian.  After the delivery guy left we realized they gave us cheese pizza instead of the vegetarian.  The receipt reflected that I was charged for the veggie not the cheese

- When I called to let them know that they sent me the wrong pie they offered to send a new one.  That was a great gesture but I had folks I needed to feed in a certain time frame, there was no time to wait for another delivery so I asked them to remove the charge from my credit card and they said it would.

- Later that day I checked my credit card statement and they charged me for the full amount.  I called them and the manager told me to call and talk to a different manager tomorrow....
author: Jinenne S.

description:
Excepting Little Star (a different thing altogether), this is my favorite pizza in the city, no matter which location.  I don't care how many times I've tried Nizario's, Marcello's, Serrano's, or Blowjo's - this is my favorite. 

The ingredients are fresh and the potato-garlic-pesto is so good, I can't not get half the pizza to have it when I order.

Tip for ordering in person by the slice: scan the pizzas that are there for the taking.  Order the one that glistens the most.  It is the freshest and greasiest and will taste the best.
author: Christian H.

description: Okay if you're really drunk and across the street at the Make-Out Room and you need a quick slice, it is okay. Serrano's at 21st (one block away) is way better and cost less.
author: Lisa K.

description: As a native of New York, I am bred to understand what good pizza is. On the West Coast, this is as good as it gets.
author: Jen T.

description: order pizza for delivery here. It was fast, the driver was polite overall a good experience. I will def come back here
author: James M.

description: $2.88 cheese and $3.33 pesto. Very thin, very tasty, foldable.  Crunchy crust.  Strange side layout gives the place a few decent seats inside and they have a couple of tables outside. Cleaner place than the Haight but with less buzz...
author: Jeff J.

description: The delivery was on time. Exactly when they said. I would have preferred they were late and finished cooking the crust. Not going to order from them again.
author: sCOTT D.

description: great place for drunken snacks after dancing all night long!  do the veggie with the artichokes, feta cheese, and sun dried tomatos; add a little tapitao then wash that bad boy down with a coke... holy mother of god...
author: Jill M.

description: They have Daiya and they deliver to my house in less than a half-hour...usually like, 20 minutes. Works for me! :)
author: Susie D.
