description: Tasty, especially when you have late-night munchies. Has definitely become a go-to spot when I'm in the area.
author: Fonda C.

description: ok so when my pizza boy dresses up as peewee, that's about as good as anything can get in a pizza place. The pizza is good, but the boy who works the counter is better! who is he???? and yes the pizza is good here!
author: Leia O.

description: $4 a slice after tax. Liking the thin crust. They don't accept credit cards on slices according to the sign, so I guess there's a minimum charge to use credit like whole pizzas only.
author: Robin L.

description:
Finally, a great pizza place that delivers in the Mission!

Delicious pizza - great toppings, perfect slightly crisp crust, always served hot.  My personal favorite is the vegetarian "Gourmet" with sun-dried tomatoes, artichoke hearts, feta cheese and spinach. But even the basic pepperoni is a treat.  

New bright & clean store, convenient location, open til 2:30 am on weekends, decent prices and great and friendly staff.  Great by the slice & offers amazingly fast delivery throughout the Mission & neighboring areas.  5 stars!
author: Alena N.

description:
I was walking around with friend (we go to ccsf) and we smelled pizza so we went inside and I loved this place
pizza are already there waiting for someone to buy it, I'm glad that they don't just get the slice and put it on a plate and hand it to u, they cook it in the oven again. which I love there idea
i like there special on weekdays $2.50 for a slice of pepperoni or cheese and there slice are pretty big and get 20% if u had a student id which we didnt get ours yet T.T
my friend ask the lady at the counter from 1-5, 5 being the best how good r ur pizza and she said 5 with confidence and I believe it really was a 5
I like how it's not to greesy and crust is not that hard and very thin, i have to say better then round tables and costco pizza.
i like how after 7 visits u get a free slice
i hate that they ran out of pepperoni because of the people in front of me and it would have been a 8 minute wait but im still happy with the cheese pizza
1 visits down just 6 more to go!
author: Derrick S.

description: Walking by 22nd street. I did not know a pizza place was there and smelled pretty good from the outside. I was looking forward to it instead of somewhere else to try. When I go there. Happy to place an order a slice until I realized. CASH ONLY ON SLICES!!! WTF!!! I was ordering 2 slices and was more than $5 dollars. That's for sure. I told the cashier or server or whatever I have not enough cash. She says I can use the ATM there. I am not going to pay extra fees just for two slices of pizza when other places take credit cards or must pay a certain amount instead of CASH ONLY ON SLICES!!! I do not carry cash due to people asking for money everywhere you go or eat. What a disappointment and I will not go back there. Lost a new customer!
author: C G.

description: "Escape from New York Pizza is the best pizza in the city..." Don't say that. That's like saying Pizza Hut is God's gift to the hungry. Escape is amazing...when you're drunk. Otherwise it's just your typical pizza place that serve you by the slice.
author: Alex H.

description: Good place to stop in before/after the Make Out Room or if you're just bar hopping around the area in general. Lots of variety in terms of toppings...pizzas are fresh and the service is friendly.
author: Yee-Shing W.

description: I'd have to be really really drunk to like this crap. Even then it would be a stretch. It's overly doughy and sticks to your teeth (left me wondering if it was insanely undercooked) and the sauce barely exists. The only "by the slice" pizza that is worth putting in your tummy in this town is Victor's on Polk.
author: Natalie G.

description: Introduced to me by my good friend Fabien on his birthday, I've had the Gourmet pizza with fresh spinach, sun dried tomatoes and artichokes.  Fantastic ingredients and top notch taste.  Get your late night pizza fix at Escape, convenient locations throughout the city.
author: Nick H.

description: I had to drop EFNY  a whole star.  This is strictly because I've stopped by three times and got slices to go and the pizza tastes totally different than when you get home delivery.  They reheat it and it looses it's awesomeness.  It's way better delivered.  And they don't have to-go boxes. They slap on another paper plate on top of your slice and put it in a paper bag.  I'm telling you, order delivery., and if ordering online, ask for the WHOOODEEEHOOO instead of the knock or door bell.  A few weeks ago I ordered a pie and  the delivery dude yelled it so loud my friend sitting next the window fell out of his seat and almost had a heart attack! Freaking hilarious!  Still consistently delicious pizza, when you have it delivered though.
author: Perry D.

description: My pizza slice MO is plain cheese. Easiest to soak the oil off and remove excess cheese. But the artichoke heart, spinach and sun-dried tomato slice at the new Escape From New York looked so good I had to go for it. Yeah, it took more effort to get the oil and cheese off, but this generously sized slice was so good, it was definitely worth it.
author: Jason B.

description:
I know, it's not 5-star pizza, but it is 4-star pizza and it is my go-to delivery place for pizza.  Let's count the reasons:

1. They always answer the phone (so far) and have good hours.

2. They deliver to Potrero unlike Amici's.

3. The pizza is pretty good and better than Goat Hill Pizza.

4. The drivers bring the pizza upstairs to my door and it's delivered in reasonably good condition and within the timeline promised.

You would think any pizza place would be able to measure up to these standards.  Well, maybe you wouldn't... anyhow, I recommend them.
author: Daniel Q.

description: I like your pizza very much.  Can you please tell me why you won't deliver to Glen Park?  I'm 5 minutes away.  Literally.  Boo hiss.
author: Emily T.

description:
a friend and i were walking back to her apartment and she wanted to grab a bite to eat and i was hungry as well, so we stopped in for a quick slice.

i'd never been to an EFNY before and was scarred it'd be like sbarro from mall food courts, but it's definitely a notch above. not quite sure that's saying a lot, but the potato garlic pizza gives it a sizable boost.

the pizzas do look a bit tired as john a. said but they reheat pretty well. just wish they'd heat them up a bit more since it was hecka cold in the city today and by the time i got to my car (3-4 blocks or so) the slice was cold :(

decent prices, i suppose, but if they cut them by 20% i'd be a really happy man.
author: Jonathan K.

description: Pretty good slice.  I love NY style thin crust.  Its especially tough to find in SF where places make pizza too fancy...   I just want aregular slice...this place has a few posh pizzas but cant go wrong with cheese or combo!
author: Naji E.

description: It's really good. I love their combo plus.  I had alot of Mission district pizza.  Deja Vu is good, but they don't make a combo pizza like this place does.  Yummy!
author: Jinny K.

description:
this is my favorite pizze place in the castro. there's a lot of competition, but escape from new york beats them out for two reasons.

1) the tomato sauce they use is just better than the rest of the pizza places in the castro. it's really flavorful. 

2) their pesto potato pizza has entire cloves of roasted garlic all over it. yum.

when picking out a slice, go for the freshest look one behind the glass. all their varieties are good, but the fresher ones taste the best.
author: Villager E.

description: Ok..I love EFNYP...the crust and the sauce. But they ain't cheap and after paying the price we got approximately 4 mushroom, maybe, sliced on our pizza. And to top it off the Pepperoni and Sausage 1/2 had maybe a teaspoon of sausage.  Come on guys! If you're gonna be that skimpy then lower your prices. So with that said...I am gonna have to start getting my pizza from a place that gives you your money's worth! GEEZ! So bye bye EFNYP!
author: Diana C.

description: HALLELUJAH! My favorite slice (You Say Potato) has come to my 'hood!
author: Maximillian M.

description:
I am so happy EFNY is my neighbor! I love the one in Russian Hill, where I used to work, so this is the same, right? 

I have only been there once since they opened and my first trip went alright.

My sister and I went in looking to buy a slice but i figured the better deal was to just buy a whole pizza. I ordered my pizza. The guy said it would be 15....15! minutes!, which was perfect because it would give me enough time to take a slow walk to the Chase ATM a few blocks down since they don't take cards. And I would be back in perfect time for my pizza. When I came back, my pizza was done....or so I thought. They had burnt the pizza. The guy at the front was very apologetic. And we only waited for another 10 minutes for our new pizza. He apologized again, let us keep the "burnt" pizza (we figured we could pick off the top and the crust) and gave us 4 free slice vouchers (probably a $15 value!). This was much nicer than what Celia's did to us. They once delivered us a half burnt pizza like it was nothing. I didn't want to waste my energy or wait another 45 minutes for them at the time.

As far as the pizza, it was yummy, just like how I remembered.
author: Lisa G.

description: I love the pizza! I have eaten many many times.  But when i ordered pizza on 1/27/12 the guys answering phones was incredibly rude.  I had to call back twice to complete my order.  I have worked in the service industry and I understand the stress of the job, but, please be kind. I am trying to give you money! I will think twice before calling here again.
author: Josh P.

description: I  was really excited to have a by-the-slice pizza place in the neighborhood and I do like the potato garlic pizza at other locations but each time Ive been here the pizza was super SALTY.  Super salty like I-might-barf-on-my-way-home-unless-I-get-a-glass-of-water-really-soon salty.   Not only that, but the pizzas look like they've been sitting out for a few hours, drinking 40s on the curb until it was time to be sold to desperately hungry people craving anything but another burrito.  Also, I do think they're a bit pricey and they skimp on the cheese.  Heck, for $8 for two slices I could get Indian food.
author: Bigfrog W.

description: Pretty good pizza.  Sf is never going to have great my pizza,but this will do.  I'm a new York transplant and choose this place when I'm craving a slice.  I've tried north star and was thoroughly unimpressed, but then again I didn't try their Chicago style, which I heard is far superior.
author: K C.

description: Stoked that EFNY is now in the Mission and can finally end Serrano's monopoly on sliced 'za in the red side of the Mission. Last time i went there, the staff knew how to heat the slice just right, so it was extra crispy but not burnt.
author: Jonathan M.
